job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a Research Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release. You will also have extensive knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and Generative AI domain.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love DALL.E, MUSE, IMAGEN, MAKE-A-VIDEO, STABLE DIFFUSION and more - and you love large data and large compute, then we would love to talk to you.

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our foundational model for video generation based on large video data-sets. You will also help build the academic contributions in this area. In this role you will be conducting cutting edge research, pushing the boundaries and going beyond existing SOTA solutions. This would include:
     * Reviewing specialised literature on text to video / video synthesis.
     * Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area.
     * Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision.
     * Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam
job_details.full_text:
Research Engineer - Video Diffusion

We are looking for a Research Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release. You will also have extensive knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and Generative AI domain.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love DALL.E, MUSE, IMAGEN, MAKE-A-VIDEO, STABLE DIFFUSION and more - and you love large data and large compute, then we would love to talk to you.

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our foundational model for video generation based on large video data-sets. You will also help build the academic contributions in this area. In this role you will be conducting cutting edge research, pushing the boundaries and going beyond existing SOTA solutions. This would include:
     * Reviewing specialised literature on text to video / video synthesis.
     * Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area.
     * Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision.
     * Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam

profile_classification.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes working with generative AI models, specifically text-to-video synthesis, and mentions several key generative models and frameworks (DALL.E, MUSE, IMAGEN, MAKE-A-VIDEO, STABLE DIFFUSION). The core responsibilities include developing foundational models for video generation, conducting cutting-edge research in this domain, building libraries to accelerate iteration, and developing production-quality software. This aligns directly with the definition and evidence profile of a GenAI Engineer, who focuses on designing, developing, fine-tuning, and deploying applications built on generative models.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves developing foundational models for video generation, conducting cutting-edge research, pushing boundaries beyond SOTA solutions, adapting off-the-shelf solutions, and optimizing prototypes into working solutions, all of which are core to model development and adaptation.
job_tasks.phrase: develop our foundational model for video generation

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'turning prototypes into working solutions' directly implies the process of refining and preparing models for production.
The mention of 'text-to-video' and 'video synthesis' points to the core generative modeling tasks.

The description explicitly states 'Developing production quality software' and 'our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product', indicating a focus on building user-facing applications.
The phrase 'full stack' implies a broad range of software development activities necessary to deliver a complete product.
The requirement to 'deliver direct to product' signifies the development of software that directly impacts users or the final product.
The responsibility to 'Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment' covers the end-to-end management of models in production.
job_tasks.phrase: Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'optimising for deployment' directly relates to the operational aspects of making models ready for production environments.

The tasks 'Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area' and 'Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision' indicate a need to understand project goals and align technical work with business objectives.
job_tasks.phrase: Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area

job_tasks.justification: The task 'Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision' shows an alignment of technical work with the overall strategic direction.
job_tasks.phrase: Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development' implies creating tools that facilitate the model development and experimentation process.
job_tasks.phrase: Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development

soft_skills.phrase: passion for working on cutting edge problems
loves to code and build working systems
used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment
experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release
Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle
